Package io.proximax.core.utils

Class StringUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.proximax.core.utils.StringUtils
  • public class StringUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Static class that contains string utility functions.

      • isNullOrEmpty

      • isNullOrWhitespace

        str - The string.
        Returns:

      • repeat

        public static java.lang.String repeat​(java.lang.String str,
                                      int repeat)

        Repeat a String repeat times to form a new String.

         StringUtils.repeat(null, 2) = null
 StringUtils.repeat("", 0)   = ""
 StringUtils.repeat("", 2)   = ""
 StringUtils.repeat("a", 3)  = "aaa"
 StringUtils.repeat("ab", 2) = "abab"
 StringUtils.repeat("a", -2) = ""
        Parameters:
        str - the String to repeat, may be null
        repeat - number of times to repeat str, negative treated as zero
        Returns:
        a new String consisting of the original String repeated, null if null String input

      • replaceVariable

        public static java.lang.String replaceVariable​(java.lang.String string,
                                               java.lang.String name,
                                               java.lang.String value)
        Replaces a variable contained in a string with a value. A variable is defined as ${variable}. This pattern is replaced by the given value.
        Parameters:
        string - String that contains variables.
        name - Name of the variable to be replaced with its value.
        value - Value that will replace the variable.
        Returns:
        string with value replacing the variable with the given name

      • getBytes

        public static byte[] getBytes​(java.lang.String s)
        Converts a string to a UTF-8 byte array.
        Parameters:
        s - The input string.
        Returns:
        The output byte array.

        public static java.lang.String getString​(byte[] bytes)
        Converts a UTF-8 byte array to a string.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The input byte array.
        Returns:
        The output string.
